com.tversity.airflinger.sdk.android
Class Player

java.lang.Object
  com.tversity.airflinger.sdk.android.Device
      com.tversity.airflinger.sdk.android.Player

public class Player
extends Device

Provides access and control to a player device

play

public void play(MediaObject media,
                 java.lang.String title,
                 java.lang.Object userData,
                 Types.ICommandCallback callback)
          throws Types.InvalidDeviceException,
                 Types.DeviceOfflineException,
                 Types.InvalidCommandException,
                 Types.InvalidParamException,
                 Types.ServiceDisconnectedException,
                 Types.UnknownErrorException
Send a URI to the player for playing

Parameters:
media - The MediaObject to play
title - Title of the media to play (some devices show this title when the media starts playing)
userData - Optional - this data will be sent back on the callback function
callback - Callback function that will be invoked after the player has performed the command. See OnCommandPerformed result param for possible result codes.
Throws:
Types.InvalidDeviceException
Types.DeviceOfflineException
Types.InvalidCommandException
Types.InvalidParamException
Types.ServiceDisconnectedException
Types.UnknownErrorException

play

public void play(MediaObject media,
                 java.lang.String title,
                 java.lang.Object userData,
                 Types.ICommandCallback callback,
                 Types.IPositionEventCallback posEventCallback)
          throws Types.InvalidDeviceException,
                 Types.DeviceOfflineException,
                 Types.InvalidCommandException,
                 Types.InvalidParamException,
                 Types.ServiceDisconnectedException,
                 Types.UnknownErrorException
Send a MediaObject to the player for playing

Note: If posEventCallback is specified, it will be invoked with the same userData that the command callback is invoked with. Therefore, the userData should not be released on command callback, rather it should be released in the OnPlayerStopped method of posEventCallback.

Parameters:
media - The MediaObject to play
title - Title of the media to play (some devices show this title when the media starts playing)
userData - Optional - this data will be sent back on the callback function
callback - Callback function that will be invoked after the player has performed the command. See OnCommandPerformed result param for possible result codes.
posEventCallback - Optional - If not null and the media is video or audio, this callback will be invoked about every second with the current position information
Throws:
Types.InvalidDeviceException
Types.DeviceOfflineException
Types.InvalidCommandException
Types.InvalidParamException
Types.ServiceDisconnectedException
Types.UnknownErrorException

play

public void play(java.lang.String uri,
                 java.lang.String title,
                 java.lang.String mimeType,
                 java.lang.Object userData,
                 Types.ICommandCallback callback)
          throws Types.InvalidDeviceException,
                 Types.DeviceOfflineException,
                 Types.InvalidCommandException,
                 Types.InvalidParamException,
                 Types.ServiceDisconnectedException,
                 Types.UnknownErrorException
Send a URI to the player for playing

Parameters:
uri - The URI to play
title - Title of the media to play (some devices show this title when the media starts playing)
mimeType - The mime type of the media. If null is sent, the SDK will try to find the mime type using the media URI
userData - Optional - this data will be sent back on the callback function
callback - Callback function that will be invoked after the player has performed the command. See OnCommandPerformed result param for possible result codes.
Throws:
Types.InvalidDeviceException
Types.DeviceOfflineException
Types.InvalidCommandException
Types.InvalidParamException
Types.ServiceDisconnectedException
Types.UnknownErrorException

play

public void play(java.lang.String uri,
                 java.lang.String title,
                 java.lang.String mimeType,
                 java.lang.Object userData,
                 Types.ICommandCallback callback,
                 Types.IPositionEventCallback posEventCallback)
          throws Types.InvalidDeviceException,
                 Types.DeviceOfflineException,
                 Types.InvalidCommandException,
                 Types.InvalidParamException,
                 Types.ServiceDisconnectedException,
                 Types.UnknownErrorException
Send a URI to the player for playing

Note: If posEventCallback is specified, it will be invoked with the same userData that the command callback is invoked with. Therefore, the userData should not be released on command callback, rather it should be released in the OnPlayerStopped method of posEventCallback.

Parameters:
uri - The URI to play
title - Title of the media to play (some devices show this title when the media starts playing)
mimeType - The mime type of the media. If null is sent, the SDK will try to find the mime type using the media URI
userData - Optional - this data will be sent back on the callback function
callback - Callback function that will be invoked after the player has performed the command. See OnCommandPerformed result param for possible result codes.
posEventCallback - Optional - If not null and the media is video or audio, this callback will be invoked about every second with the current position information
Throws:
Types.InvalidDeviceException
Types.DeviceOfflineException
Types.InvalidCommandException
Types.InvalidParamException
Types.ServiceDisconnectedException
Types.UnknownErrorException

                      throws Types.InvalidDeviceException,
                             Types.DeviceOfflineException,
                             Types.InvalidCommandException,
                             Types.InvalidParamException,
                             Types.ServiceDisconnectedException,

This method is used for sending a seek command to the player to set a new current position

Parameters:
seekTime - The new position the player should seek to in the format HH:MM:SS
userData - Optional - this data will be sent back on the callback function
callback - Callback function that will be invoked after the player has performed the command. See OnCommandPerformed result param for possible result codes.

This method is used for sending a seek command to the player to set a new current position

Parameters:
seekSecs - The new position the player should seek to in seconds form the beginning
userData - Optional - this data will be sent back on the callback function
callback - Callback function that will be invoked after the player has performed the command. See OnCommandPerformed result param for possible result codes.
